content.question: Which of the following gives the best estimate for the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a <math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 5 power molar H C l O 4 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solution at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 1.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="H C l O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong acid.

<math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 5.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>5.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="H C l O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong acid.

<math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 7.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>7.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="C l O 4 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong base.

<math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 9.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>9.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="C l O 4 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong base.

content.answer: <math alttext="p H is approximately equal to 5.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>≈</mo><mn>5.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="H C l O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is a strong acid.

topic.text: 8.2: pH and pOH of Strong Acids and Bases

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
